Newton.Mount Feake Cemetery:
Mount Feake Cemetery is a historic cemetery at 203 Prospect Street in Waltham, Massachusetts.


== Overview ==
Established in 1857, it is the city's second cemetery, after Grove Hill Cemetery, and is one of the best-preserved garden cemeteries in the state. It takes its name from its highest point, Mount Feake, which was named by Governor John Winthrop in 1632 for his future nephew-in-law, Robert Feake, one of the founding settlers of Watertown, Massachusetts.
